description.p: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

As an action, you can spend one charge and hurl the weapon up to 120 feet to a point you can see. When it reaches that point, the weapon vanishes in an explosion, and each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Afterward, you can use a bonus action to cause the weapon to reappear in your empty hand. If you don't call the weapon back to your hand, it reappears at the point where it exploded when you are no longer attuned to it or when 24 hours have passed.
The weapon contains 4 charges which recharge at dawn.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Increase Strength to 18 if higher than without. +2 Strength and Strength Maximum while Raging.
Create a 15ft cone dealing 2d8 Sonic damage DC: (8 + Prof + Str). For each successful hit with these weapons this Turn, increase Thunderclaps damage by 1d8
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
It returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack. The bonus increases to +2 when you use the mace to attack an object.

When you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with this weapon, the target takes an extra 7 bludgeoning damage, or an extra 14 bludgeoning damage if it's an object. If an object has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it is destroyed.
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Savage Stars (Bonus Action): By taking a -5 to your AC, you can gain +5 additional damage to all attacks made this turn prior to using this ability.

Restless Blood (Bonus Action): You may use a Bonus Action to spend a Hit Die to increase your damage by that Hit Die Size for the next attack. If you do not spend any Hit Dice for the day in active combat with a killing intent, then start the next day by rolling your hit dice as unsoakable damage to yourself. In the event you run out of Hit Dice, the last die used is considered to be maximized.

Back Stabbing Shade (Curse): When attacks are made by you when attunded to this item, anyone within 20ft. must make a DC 18 Wisdom Saving Throw. On failure, they see you acting in a manner that is considered violent towards a precious person or innocent. Those affected by this immediately use their reaction to attack you with whatever they have at the ready. The affect lasts for 5 minutes or until the save is made at the start of their turn or they continue to treat you as a hostile. A Persuasion Skill Check can be used to straighten them out. For the next 24 hours, they cannot shake the feeling of villainry and evil coming from you.
